text: Potassium bromate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is KBrO3. It contains potassium and bromate ions. ==Properties== Potassium bromate is a white solid. It is a strong oxidizing agent. It might be a carcinogen. ==Preparation== It can be made by dissolving bromine in hot potassium hydroxide. It can also be made by electrolysis of potassium bromide solution. ==Uses== Potassium bromate is used to make wheat flour better. Some places have banned it from being added to flour because it might be a carcinogen. Normally when the bread is baked the potassium bromate is broken down. If there is too much, then some might be left over in the bread, which is bad. ==Related pages== *Sodium bromate *Calcium bromate Category:Potassium compounds Category:Bromine compounds
